subsection_content:
Prostatitis is the medical term used to refer to an infection in the prostate. The prostate is a structure in the genitourinary system, found only in men. This gland is located under the bladder, surrounding the posterior urethra, weighs about 20 grams, has the role of secreting fluid in semen and supporting ejaculation in men. (first)
The disease manifests in acute or chronic form. The causative agent may be bacterial or non-bacterial. The usual age for prostatitis is middle-aged men around 50 years old or younger (under 40 years old).
If not detected and treated promptly, the disease can cause serious health and mental complications and affect men's fertility.
